result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry Lamon Bryant Jr

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Henry Lamon Bryant Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in court for Henry Lamon Bryant Jr.  Attorney Jon Josephsen appeared in court on behalf of Patricia Irene Daugherty for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea Hearing. Defendant not produced. Court adjourns matter for an additional plea hearing so defendant can be present. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Michael G. Levine in court, defendant Henry Lamon Bryant not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared on behalf of Annie Louk for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel requests a PGP date. Court grants request and adjourns matter for a Plea Hearing date to Br 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Michael Moran appeared in court on behalf of Michael G. Levine, defendant Henry Lamon Bryant not in court, in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Due to reasons put forth on the record, the State requests an additional Status Conference date to address len bias. No objections from defense counsel. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD-Attorney Michael G. Levine in court, defendant Henry Lamon Bryant not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared on behalf of Patricia Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion with parties. Court sets next court date for a Status Conference. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Judge Yamahiro for Judge Grayson
Defendant Henry Lamon Bryant in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Defendant Henry Lamon Bryant in custody, MSDF.  Amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Original Information received and e-filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Michael Moran on behalf of Michael G. Levine in court, defendant Henry Lamon Bryant not in court, in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Arraignment. Defendant not produced. Court adjourns matter for an aditional Arraignment so defendant can be present. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Arraignment scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Signed and Filed. ORDER PERMITTING ACCESS TO DISCOVERY MATERIALS
Received and Filed. ORDER PERMITTING ACCESS TO DISCOVERY MATERIALS

Attorney Michael G. Levine in court, defendant Henry Lamon Bryant not in court, in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Arraignment. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.  Arraignment scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Request for Substitution of Judge

Defendant Henry Lamon Bryant in court with Attorney Michael G. Levine.  Defendant Henry Lamon Bryant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 019513,
Payable Number: 988668,
Receipt Number: 22RP008172,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Henry Lamon Bryant in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Henry Lamon Bryant in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
